comments:
Symptom:
can't activate the bundle "com.ibm.celadon.rnq_1.0.0"
A bundle does not find java.sql.SQLException
I doubt the system execution environment is set to "j2se", not to "j2me CDC", so system library is expected to hold "java.sql".


Regeneration:
a. import the projects attached.
b. set target platform as "/workspace/celadon.eib.deploy/target"
c. set "installedJRE" as j9 CDC/foundation
d. click "Run > Run.." to select predefined "target_eib_config"
e. type "ss" on the osgi console and see "com.ibm.celadon.rnq_1.0.0


Environment:
Eclipse 3.2 RC4
j2se 1.4.2_06, Sun Microsystems
Windows XP

On the preferences menu, 
set java > "installedJRE" to j9 foundation 1.0 v2.2 (in IBM WSDD 5.7.1)

Created an attachment (id=42242)
projects

projects that bring you the symptom that I have got.

Per the OSGi R4 specification bundles cannot import/export a package in the java.* namespace.  To be more specific a bundle classloader is not allowed to define a class in the java.* namespace.  Only the boot classloader is allowed to define classes in the java.* namespace, this is a restriction placed on OSGi by the Java specification.  In a J2ME environment you must place the jars with the java.sql package on the boot classpath.
